solution: There are $7!$ ways to put the beads on the grid, not considering rotations and reflections. Arrangements can be reflected or not reflected and can be rotated by 0, 60, 120, 180, 240, or 300 degrees, so they come in groups of twelve equivalent arrangements. Correcting for the symmetries, we find that there are $7!/12=\boxed{420}$ distinct arrangements.
model_solution:
There are $6!$ ways to arrange the seven beads in a straight line, and thus $6!$ ways to arrange them on the hexagonal grid if reflections and rotations are ignored.

There are 6 rotational symmetries of the hexagon.
There are 3 reflection symmetries of the hexagon.
The total number of distinct arrangements is $\dfrac{6!}{6\cdot 3}$ = $\dfrac{6!}{18}$.
$\dfrac{6!}{18}=\dfrac{720}{18}=40$
$\dfrac{6!}{18}=\dfrac{720}{18}=40$
